paragraphs: When two quantities in two unknovvns are satisfied by the same pair of values for the two unknowns, they are said to be simultaneous equations.
Solution of a system of equations :
If an ordered pair of values satisfies the system $@"a_1x +b_1y + c_1 = 0"@$ and
$@"a_2x +b_2y + c_2 = 0"@$ the pair is called the solution of the system of equations.
If a system has a solution then the system is said to be consistent othervvise inconsistent.
The following system of equations is dependent.
If y = a the graph is a straight line parallel to x axis.
If x = b the graph is a straight line parallel toy axis.
For the equations : $@"a_1x + b_1y = c_1\;; a_2x + b_2y = c_2."@$
